title: I Have $40 and I'm Betting Against Time Violence | Economic Speed Run Day 1
description:
I have $40, a 630 credit score, and I'm about to speed run the economy using physics and rage.

Day 1: Explaining Time Violence, making my first conscious market play, and why Silicon Valley is lying to you

 THE SITUATION

- Bank account: $40
- Credit score: 630
- Debt: Bachelor's + Master's + half another Master's worth
- Mission: Flip the entire economy by Christmas

THE THESIS

Time Violence is the systematic theft of human consciousness through unnecessary complexity. 
Every hour you spend on hold with insurance, every form you fill out three times, every process that takes 10 hours when it should take 10 minutes - that's not inefficiency, it's violence. And it's an arbitrage opportunity.

WHAT I'M DOING

1. Documenting my paper trading strategy using the Conscious Markets framework
2. Proving that complexity arbitrage is thermodynamically inevitable
3. Building the HumAIn Bottega - turning trauma survivors into founders who destroy the systems that broke them
4. Making predictions about which companies will simplify or die

THE FIRST PLAY

Opendoor (OPEN) - 200 shares, covered call at $10 strike, October 31st expiration

Why? Jane Street just took a 6% stake. They see what I see: the home buying process is pure Time Violence, and AI is about to collapse it.

This isn't financial advice. This is economic warfare documentation.

KEY CONCEPTS

- Time Violence Score (TVS) - measuring complexity theft
- Conscious Markets - markets that acknowledge uncertainty and irreversibility
- The Bottega Model - Renaissance workshop + AI = trauma to expertise pipeline
- Complexity Arbitrage - profiting from the inevitable collapse of unnecessary bullshit
- Physics Bitches - when in doubt, remember thermodynamics
